I can’t even imagine the pain running through this community right now.

I want folks to come to our beaches and have a good time—not end up in an emergency room.

We need aggressive action from @USCPSC, including a public awareness campaign and guidance on how to properly secure beach umbrellas.

Look—no one is calling for a ban on #BeachUmbrellas. But something's wrong when ANY product can so easily take off & kill someone.

This year, I asked @USCPSC about what safety standards are in place and what can be done to protect beachgoers. But their response wasn’t enough.

Hundreds each year are rushed to emergency rooms with beach umbrella-related—including a woman impaled at the #JerseyShore last year and a #VirginiaBeach woman killed by a flying beach umbrella in 2016. pic.twitter.com/a7a8znESgG

Last week, even @TheDailyShow brought attention to this. But it’s no laughing matter—it’s a real #PublicHealth hazard every time a powerful gust of wind tears a beach umbrella right out of the sand and turns it into a projectile spear. pic.twitter.com/nBHLVOKjCv

There’s no better time to be at the Jersey Shore. We have beautiful beaches, lifeguards & police keeping us safe, and legislation to keep the water clean.

What we don’t have? Guidance about the dangers posed by unsecured, #BeachUmbrellas-turned-spears flying in the wind.
